text: There are 10 types of people: those who understand binary and those who don't.
A SQL query walks into a bar and asks: 'May I join you?'
HR called — they said you need to attend the 'mandatory fun' meeting.
C++ developers never die — they just go out of scope.
Our team runs like a well-oiled machine — mostly leaking and full of noise.

q: What's a programmer's favorite place in the house?
a: The living ROOM!

q: Why do programmers prefer dark mode?
a: Because light attracts bugs!

text: Documentation is like true love — it exists only in fairy tales.

q: What's a frontend developer's favorite sandwich?
a: One with lots of CSS (cheese sauce sauce)!

text: The code worked on my machine, so I'm shipping my machine.

q: Why did the React component feel lost?
a: Because it didn't know its state in life!

text: My code doesn't work, I have no idea why. My code works, I have no idea why.

q: Why did the JavaScript developer quit his job?
a: Because he didn't get arrays!

text: The real joke is the code I wrote 6 months ago.

q: Why was the math book sad?
a: Because it had too many problems!

text: I would tell you a UDP joke, but you might not get it.

q: Why do programmers hate nature?
a: It has too many bugs!

text: Copy-Paste was programmed by programmers for programmers actually.

q: What's a computer's favorite dance?
a: Algorithm!

text: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.

q: Why did the neural network break up with its dataset?
a: It found too many outliers in the relationship.

text: Startup meetings are just therapy sessions with PowerPoint slides.

q: What do you call a developer who doesn’t test their code?

text: The cloud is just someone else’s computer with better marketing.

a: Because he lost his domain in a phishing scam.

text: AI: the only thing that confidently gives wrong answers faster than humans.

a: Because they never know if you’ll get them or not.

text: My Wi-Fi dropped during my online therapy. Even my connection has attachment issues.

a: It had a virus.

text: Gamers don’t age — they just respawn slower.

a: None. That’s a hardware problem.

a: To improve its inner algorithm.

text: My favorite exercise is a cross between a lunge and a crunch… I call it lunch.

a: Because it had no side effects.

text: That moment when you realize your job title is just ‘professional Googler’.

a: Because good luck hiding when you’re always seeking funding.

text: My password is the name of my crush… now my login is unrequited too.

text: My productivity app keeps reminding me how unproductive I am.

a: The local host.

a: Because he kept trying to level up the teacher.

a: It had a hard drive.

text: A good commit message is like a good joke — if you have to explain it, it’s bad.

a: They always kick up errors.

text: I dream in code and wake up in syntax errors.

a: He didn’t like the table layout.

text: Every startup has a mascot — it’s usually an overworked developer.

a: A hobbyte.

text: The difference between hardware and software: you can hit hardware.

text: Our startup is so lean, even our bugs are on a diet.
